Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval).</p></div></div><div content-id=\"fig19\" class=\"fig fig-modal reveal-modal\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A6.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284figa6.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=uxph3Vj1wkOJe5jtWGpecpUrVAEOv2RsuljPswyf2Y7SLZxiqy707wf1yC~2t5EH3ttG1D0MtsS7OYxQnlP1I7VLn-UIovLKBVOsvGKHXEsKDxAF7ByLiLeZRXf~MKVu62US7wouCNcphse5ybYDF7gUSLg1FtOdvmabbD1RGzy-X2tdyB2FQANi2vTeDpjrOhAsYgnSYZL4wCmaEf2lkro7rNeRzEYNapLjoTAcTIkzuis7qQ4XWlZGPSwIvHR2zo6MagN2loYKW0kj8vDEgLkmig~4uN4WNlxQnpXTD3iGOzlDx4YPQdk-JHTieCkrBfWOgc1dvoE3tI~ASWUjfw__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters for a fit with \u03c4 &gt; 0 SFR models. The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval).\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa6.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975354/stt2284figa6.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa6.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975354\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284figa6.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=muiZCowTBJg-yjDBrChL0CNnZ7OicfXD5GULG2Gc7jmmZBSbt2aF7z3UGqTyTIazsEmuXdALNnk3o03~DdauIU8X5gh5-p3-dWY7nSqqiMa8vjPnJqELVe6lCyYjw1V-z59X5O9WbgheH~oNmcjtRj-U7lK6USfYWTHZHpUsjWUTE5LOvCsPuwgilZhE3baKrNeZhJJ65cOIAwz6ZNEn8MUvmZlthfc4-yoZ06NVW3JyipScvM-oHGeWN7rrEprHS0kOXydr0QFeD8vdJS19t107vcDuIk2MGZfRtQ5mWRXBK8lZ9zBe257Rpf9J-f9BUQkePHwBqImz88JgLW7SgA__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975354&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa6.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters for a fit with \u03c4 &gt; 0 SFR models. The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval).</p></div></div>                        <a id=\"91975355\" scrollto-destination=\"91975355\"></a>\r\n<div data-id=\"fig20\" class=\"fig fig-section js-fig-section\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A7.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284figa7.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=DvSxnGhN6BjVs01c-gOIo3blf65dkmb0sT6h2GoJeFALjUn6467f~0JiJvap9eXmiBRfWEMmAKxea3CZZCeYs0UMFQ0irWWaxCltAytfkto1SaBfiLnHCjGIsTd9mNSgUiye5nHoBqgT83deFkj8Om0Yzkn0jHJbMnqxyESvcXiV7KhJ01dHf78oukCHiocRv4oUt6-KcqIceJp9UvctQQWQPi5QU3CIYNsFGkutB7KErRk3kLWTOgnN7I7NFE9uGK3BipTgXjAwuybxj9or7HIv~mYt58MXlDp-aU~RU3sIB1iuMuIEnaTsHievQTYfefoFPsB0atIYiO8MbNAV-Q__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters for a fit with SSPs only. The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval). The best-fitting age does not necessarily lie within the interval, as is the case for ID2.\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa7.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975355/stt2284figa7.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa7.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975355\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284figa7.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=wwHNQonBOsn76stiXRoi-r6EFAlmgXBlRca5-FoS5KbLlfdhae0yVKcF7wg5l7NoaTGlbj6nhA-PMVmtT1JWEmuFFIhEFyuOtEy6NPAKfJFaoDW2gGhU1ZnbyyRabSXWjqLgsNZ6wIfKUVvcuxf17oeL~ljewLHo-DM2CLNE0eqw27b~6ovjEfBKfBtDgyrFznhyKNORJQlXj-zrrsm6p3kcaAvw4u8aOwT1r2tGUQGZth5VfmLUDBsiv55FZZiVaKXkPQIPrGxSGNv1zohbuBw-UoyCGcVWyyru5n9-l~HrJYd0vEEJexVmG0B0IlKSoEsRy~LlG8StYYnV4M5kqg__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975355&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa7.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters for a fit with SSPs only. The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval). The best-fitting age does not necessarily lie within the interval, as is the case for ID2.</p></div></div><div content-id=\"fig20\" class=\"fig fig-modal reveal-modal\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A7.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284figa7.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=DvSxnGhN6BjVs01c-gOIo3blf65dkmb0sT6h2GoJeFALjUn6467f~0JiJvap9eXmiBRfWEMmAKxea3CZZCeYs0UMFQ0irWWaxCltAytfkto1SaBfiLnHCjGIsTd9mNSgUiye5nHoBqgT83deFkj8Om0Yzkn0jHJbMnqxyESvcXiV7KhJ01dHf78oukCHiocRv4oUt6-KcqIceJp9UvctQQWQPi5QU3CIYNsFGkutB7KErRk3kLWTOgnN7I7NFE9uGK3BipTgXjAwuybxj9or7HIv~mYt58MXlDp-aU~RU3sIB1iuMuIEnaTsHievQTYfefoFPsB0atIYiO8MbNAV-Q__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters for a fit with SSPs only. The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval). The best-fitting age does not necessarily lie within the interval, as is the case for ID2.\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa7.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975355/stt2284figa7.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa7.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975355\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284figa7.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=wwHNQonBOsn76stiXRoi-r6EFAlmgXBlRca5-FoS5KbLlfdhae0yVKcF7wg5l7NoaTGlbj6nhA-PMVmtT1JWEmuFFIhEFyuOtEy6NPAKfJFaoDW2gGhU1ZnbyyRabSXWjqLgsNZ6wIfKUVvcuxf17oeL~ljewLHo-DM2CLNE0eqw27b~6ovjEfBKfBtDgyrFznhyKNORJQlXj-zrrsm6p3kcaAvw4u8aOwT1r2tGUQGZth5VfmLUDBsiv55FZZiVaKXkPQIPrGxSGNv1zohbuBw-UoyCGcVWyyru5n9-l~HrJYd0vEEJexVmG0B0IlKSoEsRy~LlG8StYYnV4M5kqg__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975355&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa7.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters for a fit with SSPs only. The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval). The best-fitting age does not necessarily lie within the interval, as is the case for ID2.</p></div></div>                        <a id=\"91975356\" scrollto-destination=\"91975356\"></a>\r\n<div data-id=\"fig21\" class=\"fig fig-section js-fig-section\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A8.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284figa8.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=kjFhwUhLGofHQI~HnnkOTOJaJJwaeOK00cZhAMXVOXhgOrnlEs9GLwbwtSEtgp~SElqrx44QVMHXadCXR5Q0pJeyFJrKSmIyYcW0v7Ve89MfwHdRqnmBQX7dBzo3gUYQb6Eyo1U~Ox55g-lm9WxBEHe0o8392pn4bHnWbCjjQGcsZB6QMFEnUc96471o5zB3Cf5ppYvRw6E1q-ADEgvpoocDo~kYHrGl5-i8Z6qXC3GjdqVzbFn-PvMxVGDcPclmlPXNHXEte2NrCDsYinPUXeJe~yqMieiXAOG~1GLZTAUg84K8uaZSgseL61O75Bq6WssM45Wb7dNQni-hM4EIuw__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters where the model set comprises all created model SEDs (SSPs and CSPs). The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval).\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa8.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975356/stt2284figa8.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa8.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975356\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284figa8.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=O3V-rYz2t72WFYaz79A22LqdFGgAJ9wvOSF5kW2tHvkwKQqwvo26AwcZ7X4VtTmUDKf6H8MldAeOLiLPOfMfjf93QMEisJ1o94mCCOQI1WJPO9~B4ZQFt18~pyV7weTepcjLYMoHfVqzaSj-1nOKpSnIfwEvuGBJVHHbKX-humPj~QaAu-p6ITmUNptoNCQQexLuXEXJIJzrf12QKAzmo5GxLRVqg2qdlEFAXV0HLsovXymOBN8bLnecHuy7loBHmh0gxyl9~tZfa5MZzuPSj69p7mMjxAU2wVq7394lPpH6KHsZusvpH4J52f3~c-mJ8ISrFa0K8UwuWNJ3HbhM1A__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975356&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa8.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters where the model set comprises all created model SEDs (SSPs and CSPs). The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval).</p></div></div><div content-id=\"fig21\" class=\"fig fig-modal reveal-modal\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure A8.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284figa8.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=kjFhwUhLGofHQI~HnnkOTOJaJJwaeOK00cZhAMXVOXhgOrnlEs9GLwbwtSEtgp~SElqrx44QVMHXadCXR5Q0pJeyFJrKSmIyYcW0v7Ve89MfwHdRqnmBQX7dBzo3gUYQb6Eyo1U~Ox55g-lm9WxBEHe0o8392pn4bHnWbCjjQGcsZB6QMFEnUc96471o5zB3Cf5ppYvRw6E1q-ADEgvpoocDo~kYHrGl5-i8Z6qXC3GjdqVzbFn-PvMxVGDcPclmlPXNHXEte2NrCDsYinPUXeJe~yqMieiXAOG~1GLZTAUg84K8uaZSgseL61O75Bq6WssM45Wb7dNQni-hM4EIuw__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters where the model set comprises all created model SEDs (SSPs and CSPs). Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval).\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa8.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975356/stt2284figa8.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa8.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975356\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284figa8.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=O3V-rYz2t72WFYaz79A22LqdFGgAJ9wvOSF5kW2tHvkwKQqwvo26AwcZ7X4VtTmUDKf6H8MldAeOLiLPOfMfjf93QMEisJ1o94mCCOQI1WJPO9~B4ZQFt18~pyV7weTepcjLYMoHfVqzaSj-1nOKpSnIfwEvuGBJVHHbKX-humPj~QaAu-p6ITmUNptoNCQQexLuXEXJIJzrf12QKAzmo5GxLRVqg2qdlEFAXV0HLsovXymOBN8bLnecHuy7loBHmh0gxyl9~tZfa5MZzuPSj69p7mMjxAU2wVq7394lPpH6KHsZusvpH4J52f3~c-mJ8ISrFa0K8UwuWNJ3HbhM1A__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975356&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284figa8.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">PDF of the model age for ID2&amp;3, marginalized over the other fitting parameters where the model set comprises all created model SEDs (SSPs and CSPs). The dashed lines are the ages of the best-fitting models. Between the dotted lines the total probability is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval).</p></div></div>        <!-- /foreach -->\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n        <div src=\"//ouptag.scholarlyiq.com/ntpagetag.gif?js=0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" border=\"0\" hspace=\"0\" vspace=\"0\" alt=\"Scholarly IQ\" />\r\n    </noscript>\r\n\r\n\r\n    <div class=\"ad-banner or footers": {"Overview": " class=\"chapter-para\">We also perform the SED fitting for the 208 galaxy candidates at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 from B13. We plot in Fig.\u00a0<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-fig12\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"fig12\" data-open=\"fig12\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">12</a> the best-fitting ages versus masses for these candidates, together with the results we get for our system, R11 and Z12. Our candidates have age and mass similar to many young candidates from B13. In Fig.\u00a0<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-fig13\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"fig13\" data-open=\"fig13\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">13</a> we show the histograms for best age, with the lower- and upper-age limits, for B13 and our candidates. Although the large 2\u03c3 confidence level intervals, we see that our multiple lensed system is definitely among the young sample of <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 galaxies. Moreover, we also estimate the UV slope \u03b2 from the best SED fitting templates for all the sources and we get that our candidate belongs to the sample of galaxies with very steep UV slope (\u03b2\u00a0\u223c\u00a02.6\u20132.9). Moreover, although the large 2\u03c3 confidence level intervals on the ages, our SED fitting suggests a very young best age for our system, compared to the other <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 multiply lensed galaxies (Z12 and R11), while the Z12 and R11 have confirmed older ages, in agreement with the results from the literature."}, "Action": "Scanned all subtables", "Status": "Complete"}, "Table set 4": {"Status": "Skipped", "Action": "Not saving duplicates", "Link": "https://academic.oup.com/view-large/91975326", "Response": "\r\n\r\n\r\n<!DOCTYPE html>\r\n<html lang=\"en\" Academic</title>\r\n\r\n        <script src=\"https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.2.4/jquery.min.js\" type=\"text/javascript\"></script>\n<script>window.jQuery || document.write('<script Positive values for \u03c4 stand for an exponentially decreasing SFR, SFR \u221d exp\u2009(\u2212<em>t</em>/\u03c4), while negative values denote an increasing SFR. We interpolate the PDF of model ages (see also Figs\u00a0A5 to A8) and calculate the age interval within which the probability of a fit is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval). These 2\u03c3 intervals are given in brackets in the column \u2018age\u2019. The same is done for the masses, where the corresponding intervals are in column \u2018<em>M</em><sub>*</sub>\u2019. Note that the age and mass values of the best-fitting model do not necessarily lie in the calculated intervals.</p></div> </div><div class=\"table-overflow\"><table><thead><tr><th>ID<span openInAnotherWindow btn js-view-large\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"/view-large/[XSLTSectionID][QueryString]\">\r\n          Open in new tab\r\n        </a></div></div></div><div class=\"table-full-width-wrap\"><div class=\"table-wrap table-wide\"><div class=\"table-wrap-title\" id=\"tbl5\" data-id=\"tbl5\"><span class=\"label\">Table\u00a05.</span><div class=\"caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Best-fitting parameters from SED fitting for CSPs, SSPs, and all models combined. Positive values for \u03c4 stand for an exponentially decreasing SFR, SFR \u221d exp\u2009(\u2212<em>t</em>/\u03c4), while negative values denote an increasing SFR. We interpolate the PDF of model ages (see also Figs\u00a0A5 to A8) and calculate the age interval within which the probability of a fit is 95.45\u2009 per cent (corresponding to a 2\u03c3 confidence interval). These 2\u03c3 intervals are given in brackets in the column \u2018age\u2019. The same is done for the masses, where the corresponding intervals are in column \u2018<em>M</em><sub>*</sub>\u2019. Note that the age and mass values of the best-fitting model do not necessarily lie in the calculated intervals.</p></div> </div><div class=\"table-overflow\"><table><thead><tr><th>ID<span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th><th>\u03c4/Gyr<span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th><th><em>Z</em>\u2009/Z<sub>\u2299</sub><span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th><th>Age [age]/Myr<span aria-hidden=\"true\" .\u00a0</span></th><th><em>A</em><sub>V</sub><span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td (function () {\r\n            var hfSiteUrl = document.getElementById('hfSiteURL');\r\n            var siteUrl = hfSiteUrl.value;\r\n            var subdomainIndex = siteUrl.indexOf('/');\r\n\r\n            hfSiteUrl.value = location.host + (subdomainIndex >= 0 ? siteUrl.substring(subdomainIndex) : '');\r\n        })();\r\n    </script>\r\n<input id=\"routename\" name=\"RouteName\" type=\"hidden\" Society</em>, Volume 438, Issue 2, 21 February 2014, Pages 1417\u20131434, <a href='https://doi.org/10.1093/mnras/stt2284'>https://doi.org/10.1093/mnras/stt2284</a></div>\r\n        </div>\r\n        <div class=\"pub-history-row clearfix\">\r\n            <div class=\"ww-citation-date-wrap\">\r\n                <div class=\"citation-label\">Published:</div>\r\n                <div class=\"citation-date\">19 December 2013</div>\r\n            </div>\r\n                <a href=\"javascript:;\" class=\"ww-citation-history-wrap js-article-history st-article-history\">\r\n                    <span>Article history</span><i class=\"icon-general-arrow-filled-down arrow-icon\"></i>\r\n                </a>\r\n        </div>\r\n            <div class=\"history-entries-wrap js-history-entries-wrap\">\r\n                <div class=\"history-entry\">\r\n                    <div class=\"wi-state\">Received:</div>\r\n                    <div class=\"wi-date\">11 August 2013</div>\r\n                </div>\r\n                <div class=\"history-entry\">\r\n                    <div class=\"wi-state\">Revision received:</div>\r\n                    <div class=\"wi-date\">22 November 2013</div>\r\n                </div>\r\n                <div class=\"history-entry\">\r\n                    <div class=\"wi-state\">Accepted:</div>\r\n                    <div class=\"wi-date\">23 November 2013</div>\r\n                </div>\r\n                <div class=\"history-entry\">\r\n                    <div class=\"wi-state\">Published:</div>\r\n                    <div class=\"wi-date\">19 December 2013</div>\r\n                </div>\r\n        </div>\r\n</div>\r\n    </div>\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n<script>\r\n    $(document).ready(function () {\r\n        $('.article-top-widget').on('click', '.ati-toggle-trigger', function () {\r\n            $(this).find('.icon-general-add, .icon-minus').toggleClass('icon-minus icon-general-add');\r\n            $(this).siblings('.ati-toggle-content').toggleClass('hide');\r\n        });\r\n\r\n        // In Chrome, an anchor tag with target=\"_blank\" and a \"mailto:\" href opens a new tab/window as well as the email client\r\n        // I suspect this behavior will be corrected in the future\r\n        // Remove the target=\"_blank\"\r\n        $('ul.wi-affiliationList').find('a[href^=\"mailto:\"]').each(function () {\r\n            $(this).removeAttr('target');\r\n        });\r\n    });\r\n</script>\r\n\r\n \n    </div>\n    <div class=\"widget widget-ArticleLinks widget-instance-OUP_Article_Links_Widget\">\n         \n    </div>\n\r\n\r\n        <div class=\"article-body js-content-body\">\r\n            <div class=\"toolbar-wrap js-toolbar-wrap\">\r\n                <div class=\"toolbar-inner-wrap\">\r\n                    <ul id=\"Toolbar\" role=\"navigation\">\r\n    <li class=\"toolbar-item item-pdf\">\r\n        <a class=\"al-link pdf article-pdfLink\" data-article-id=\"1010021\" href=\"/mnras/article-pdf/438/2/1417/18500146/stt2284.pdf\">\r\n            <img src=//oup.silverchair-cdn.com/UI/app/svg/pdf.svg alt=\"pdf\" /><span class=\"pdf-link-text\">PDF</span>\r\n        </a>\r\n    </li>\r\n                                                    <li class=\"toolbar-item item-link item-split-view\">\r\n                                <a href=\"javascript:;\"\r\n                                   class=\"split-view js-split-view st-split-view\"\r\n                                   target=\"\">\r\n                                    <i class=\"icon-menu_split\"></i>\r\n                                    Split View\r\n                                </a>\r\n                            </li>\r\n                        <li class=\"toolbar-item item-with-dropdown item-views\">\r\n                            <a class=\"at-views-dropdown drop-trigger\" href=\"javascript:;\" data-dropdown=\"FilterDrop\" aria-haspopup=\"true\">\r\n                                <i class=\"icon-menu_views\"></i>\r\n                                <div class=\"toolbar-label\">\r\n                                    <div class=\"toolbar-text\">Views</div>\r\n                                    <i class=\"icon-general-arrow-filled-down arrow-icon\"></i>\r\n                                </div>\r\n                            </a>\r\n                            <ul id=\"ViewsDrop\" class=\"f-dropdown\" data-dropdown-content aria-label=\"submenu\">\r\n                                <div class=\"arrow-up\"></div>\r\n                                <li class=\"article-content-filter js-article-content-filter\"               <li class=\"at-figures-tables article-content-filter js-article-content-filter\" data-content-filter=\"figures-tables\">\r\n                                    <a href=\"javascript:;\"><span>Figures &amp; tables</span></a>\r\n                                </li>\r\n                                <li class=\"article-content-filter js-article-content-filter\" data-content-filter=\"video\">\r\n                                    <a href=\"javascript:;\"><span>Video</span></a>\r\n                                </li>\r\n                                <li class=\"article-content-filter js-article-content-filter\" data-content-filter=\"audio\">\r\n                                    <a href=\"javascript:;\"><span>Audio</span></a>\r\n                                </li>\r\n                                <li class=\"article-content-filter js-article-content-filter\" data-content-filter=\"supplementary-data\">\r\n                                    <a href=\"javascript:;\"><span>Supplementary Data</span></a>\r\n                                </li>\r\n                            </ul>\r\n                        </li>\r\n                        <li class=\"toolbar-item\">\r\n    <div class=\"widget widget-ToolboxGetCitation widget-instance-OUP_Get_Citation\">\n        <a href=\"#\" class=\"js-cite-button\" data-reveal-id=\"getCitation\" data-reveal><i class=\"icon-read-more\"></i><span>Cite</span></a>\r\n\r\n<div id=\"getCitation\" class=\"reveal-modal\" data-reveal>\r\n    <h3 class=\"modal-title\">Cite</h3>\r\n        <div class=\"oxford-citation-text\">\r\n            <p>A. Monna, S. Seitz, N. Greisel, T. Eichner, N. Drory, M. Postman, A. Zitrin, D. Coe, A. Halkola, S. H. Suyu, C. Grillo, P. Rosati, D. Lemze, I. Balestra, J. Snigula, L. Bradley, K. Umetsu, A. Koekemoer, U. Kuchner, L. Moustakas, M. Bartelmann, N. Ben\u00edtez, R. Bouwens, T. Broadhurst, M. Donahue, H. Ford, O. Host, L. Infante, Y. Jimenez-Teja, S. Jouvel, D. Kelson, O. Lahav, E. Medezinski, P. Melchior, M. Meneghetti, J. Merten, A. Molino, J. Moustakas, M. Nonino, W. Society</em>, Volume 438, Issue 2, 21 February 2014, Pages 1417\u20131434, <a href=\"https://doi.org/10.1093/mnras/stt2284\">https://doi.org/10.1093/mnras/stt2284</a></p>\r\n        </div>\r\n\r\n       <nav class=\"navbar-menu\">\r\n\r\n        </nav>\r\n            <div class=\"navbar-search-container js-navbar-search-container\">\r\n                <a href=\"javascript:;\" class=\"navbar-search-close js_close-navsearch\">Close</a>\r\n                    <div class=\"navbar-search\">\r\n                        <div id=\"MicrositeSearch\" class=\"microsite-search\">\r\n                            <label for=\"navbar-search-filter\" class=\"screenreader-text\">search filter</label>\r\n                            <select class=\"navbar-search-filter\" id=\"navbar-search-filter\">\r\n                                                                    <optgroup label=\"Search within this journal\">\r\n       </select>\r\n\r\n                            <label for=\"MicrositeSearchTerm\" class=\"screenreader-text\">search input</label>\r\n                            <input class=\"navbar-search-input     <div class=\"navbar-search-advanced\"><a href=\"/mnras/advanced-search\" class=\"advanced-search js-advanced-search\">Advanced Search</a></div>\r\n            </div>            <div class=\"navbar-search-collapsed\"><a href=\"javascript:;\" class=\"icon-menu_search js_expand-navsearch\"><span class=\"screenreader-text\">Search Menu</span></a></div>\r\n    </div>\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n<input id=\"hfEnableOupOnlineProductsFeatures\" name=\"hfEnableOupOnlineProductsFeatures\" type=\"hidden\" value=\"False\" />\r\n\r\n<input id=\"routename\" name=\"RouteName\" type=\"hidden\" value=\"mnras\" /> \n    </div>\n\r\n                    </div>\r\n                </div>\r\n            </div>\r\n            <div id=\"ContentTab\" class=\"content active\">\r\n    <div class=\"widget widget-ArticleFulltext widget-instance-OUP_Article_FullText_Widget\">\n        <div class=\"module-widget\">\r\n    <div class=\"widget-items\" data-widgetname=\"ArticleFulltext\">\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n                    <h2 scrollto-destination=91975241 id=\"91975241\" class=\"abstract-title\" >Abstract</h2>\r\n<section class=\"abstract\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">We present a quintuply lensed <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 candidate discovered in the field of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (<em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a00.348) targeted within the Cluster Lensing and Supernova survey with Hubble (CLASH) and selected in the deep Hubble Space Telescope (<em>HST</em>) frontier fields survey. Thanks to the CLASH 16-band <em>HST</em> imaging, we identify the quintuply lensed <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 candidate as an optical dropout in the inner region of the cluster, the brightest image having mag<sub>AB</sub>\u00a0=\u00a024.8\u00a0\u00b1\u00a00.1 in the f105w filter. We perform a detailed photometric analysis to verify its high-<em>z</em> and lensed nature. We get as photometric redshift <em>z</em><sub>ph</sub>\u00a0\u223c\u00a05.9, and given the extended nature and NIR colours of the lensed images, we rule out low-<em>z</em> early-type and galactic star contaminants. We perform a strong lensing analysis of the cluster, using 13 families of multiple lensed images identified in the <em>HST</em> images. Our final best model predicts the high-<em>z</em> quintuply lensed system with a position accuracy of 0.8 arcsec. The magnifications of the five images are between 2.2 and 8.3, which leads to a delensed UV luminosity of <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$L_{1600}\\sim 0.5L_{1600}^*$|</span> at <em>z</em>\u00a0=\u00a06. We also estimate the UV slope from the observed NIR colours, finding a steep \u03b2\u00a0=\u00a0\u22122.89\u00a0\u00b1\u00a00.38. We use singular and composite stellar population SEDs to fit the photometry of the high-<em>z</em> candidate, and we conclude that it is a young (age &lt;300\u2009Myr) galaxy with mass of <em>M</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a010<sup>8</sup>\u2009M<sub>\u2299</sub>, subsolar metallicity (<em>Z</em>\u00a0&lt;\u00a00.2\u2009Z<sub>\u2299</sub>) and low dust content (<em>A</em><sub><em>V</em></sub>\u00a0\u223c\u00a00.2\u20130.4).</p></section>                        <div class=\"article-metadata-panel clearfix\"></div>\r\n<div class=\"kwd-group\"><a class=\"kwd-part kwd-main\" href=\"javascript:;\" data-keyword=\"&quot;gravitational lensing: strong&quot;\">gravitational lensing: strong</a>, <a class=\"kwd-part kwd-main\" href=\"javascript:;\" data-keyword=\"&quot;galaxies: clusters: general&quot;\">galaxies: clusters: general</a>, <a class=\"kwd-part kwd-main\" href=\"javascript:;\" data-keyword=\"&quot;galaxies: high-redshift&quot;\">galaxies: high-redshift</a></div>                    <h2 scrollto-destination=91975243 id=\"91975243\" class=\"section-title\" data-legacy-id=sec1>INTRODUCTION</h2>\r\n<p class=\"chapter-para\">The Cluster Lensing And Supernovae survey with Hubble (CLASH; Postman et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib46\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib46\" data-open=\"bib46\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012a</a>) is a 524-orbit multicycle treasury <em>Hubble Space Telescope</em> (<em>HST</em>) program, which is targeting 25 clusters of galaxies with the main goal to measure accurate cluster mass profiles by combining space-based strong lensing analyses and ground-based weak lensing analyses (see Coe et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib17\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib17\" data-open=\"bib17\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>; Umetsu et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib55\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib55\" data-open=\"bib55\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>; Medezinski et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib43\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib43\" data-open=\"bib43\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2013</a>). In addition, taking advantage that galaxy clusters act as gravitational lenses, CLASH also aims to identify and investigate magnified galaxies which contribute to reionize the intergalactic medium (IGM) in the early Universe at redshift <em>z</em> \u2273 6. Up to date several lensed galaxies at <em>z</em> &gt; 5 are identified in galaxy clusters fields, e.g. a galaxy at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 lensed into three images in A383 (Richard et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib49\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib49\" data-open=\"bib49\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2011</a>, hereafter R11) (spectroscopically confirmed), a lensed galaxy at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06.56 in A370 (Hu et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib32\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib32\" data-open=\"bib32\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2002</a>) (spectroscopically confirmed), seven lensed galaxies at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a07 in A1703 (Bradley et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib9\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib9\" data-open=\"bib9\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>) (one of which spectroscopically confirmed), a quadruply lensed galaxy at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06.2 in the field of MACS0329 (Zitrin et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib58\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib58\" data-open=\"bib58\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>, hereafter Z12), a triply lensed galaxy at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a07 in A2218 (Kneib et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib36\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib36\" data-open=\"bib36\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2004</a>), a highly magnified galaxy at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a09.6 (Zheng et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib56\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib56\" data-open=\"bib56\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>) in MACS1149 and a triply lensed galaxy at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a011 in MACS0647 (Coe et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib17\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib17\" data-open=\"bib17\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>). The last two sources are the highest redshift lensed candidates detected to date, and were discovered within the CLASH survey. A large sample of single and multiply lensed high-<em>z</em>candidate galaxies identified in the CLASH survey are described and analysed in Bradley et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib10\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib10\" data-open=\"bib10\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2013</a>, hereafter B13).</p><p class=\"chapter-para\">In this paper we present a candidate quintuply lensed galaxy at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 discovered in the field of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (hereafter RXC J2248) that we identify thanks to the wide CLASH photometric data set (see Fig.\u00a0<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-fig1\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"fig1\" data-open=\"fig1\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">1</a>).</p>                        <a id=\"91975246\" scrollto-destination=\"91975246\"></a>\r\n<div data-id=\"fig1\" class=\"fig fig-section js-fig-section\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure 1.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284fig1.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=EpOkMi4muimBwiYrzJ~lpvZ8axJavZPLNvQTjH9oyTFnVUL~yfeehX0PV3ew-NF-OOucUWHP42y-eI1wdrGyNhB2sYRaSfK2AKUejfHuLNJ1dCo3nI7SDqxq8zWEvIiJdF5fQrbZXseGmM9gGh0h-0feCxzmPjgoD5~dxZgYND4lw4ofrrIOnqp2ctoJE1nvuJ9NyKcXBKT-~M76N0HRirnzxekwyUEkBku6hi~uXWpX~49DZgaKq2EhOlzUx54F~Z5KoGBRdpyMFD9-7QJt-l-bO0OW2Co6nowLShueYiAKsx6O5nI4k1eqp7k4svv9V3pDikKw-QIbaJTQXeesKg__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"2\u00a0\u00d7\u00a02 arcmin2 colour image of RXC J2248.7\u22124431 core, from the HST 16-band of the CLASH survey: blue\u00a0=\u00a0F435w+F475w; green\u00a0=\u00a0F606w+F625w+F775w+F814w+F850lp; red = F105w+F110w+F140w+F160w. We label the multiple lensed systems used in the strong lensing analysis (see Section\u00a05). The systems 12, 13 and the lensed image 11.c are new systems recently identified in the model. We verified that including these systems in the model is not changing significantly the final best model or the errors on the model parameters (see Section\u00a05 for more details). The red circles (ID0-4) label the quintuply lensed dropout candidate at z\u00a0\u223c\u00a06. The central image ID0 is selected after removing the BCG light (see Section\u00a06). With rD we label the other r-dropout candidate at z\u00a0\u223c\u00a05 identified through photometric selection (see Section\u00a03).\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig1.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975246/stt2284fig1.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig1.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975246\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284fig1.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=X2I-Gv-kEK37fLDQSPeqsUPxL9OGTF1sbQyv0PMMBPIxwOfh-IYUSfiS2PszMSuRbFxtLJbO9--ZvtG3rLuGOtaVPoxlW47wvMizxo8-TBfDsyk0vFsoGSKomz7SfEHc8BesWFwubUou0sG9q7DPVXxmMPkPxBsH3uOBZY~x~Q0Bt4gKdqUB0OcwD1ELvzXQBLSHqQqMI5VGl0UvjIyghSBkhWuzl1gOlO4cYXnMI46lCsEYlC~q0UJec2qs1~B1d36kuXmX4ojUmaaQhK7s9P6NnpYy1D-jo-FjYUqw3IpJr~Xj8y3rUnyGee1Lq~YheRrItirxYKebNJKrOfEuHQ__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975246&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig1.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">2\u00a0\u00d7\u00a02 arcmin<sup>2</sup> colour image of RXC J2248.7\u22124431 core, from the <em>HST</em> 16-band of the CLASH survey: blue\u00a0=\u00a0F435w+F475w; green\u00a0=\u00a0F606w+F625w+F775w+F814w+F850lp; red = F105w+F110w+F140w+F160w. We label the multiple lensed systems used in the strong lensing analysis (see Section\u00a05). The systems 12, 13 and the lensed image 11.c are new systems recently identified in the model. We verified that including these systems in the model is not changing significantly the final best model or the errors on the model parameters (see Section\u00a05 for more details). The red circles (ID0-4) label the quintuply lensed dropout candidate at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06. The central image ID0 is selected after removing the BCG light (see Section\u00a06). With rD we label the other r-dropout candidate at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a05 identified through photometric selection (see Section\u00a03).</p></div></div><div content-id=\"fig1\" class=\"fig fig-modal reveal-modal\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure 1.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284fig1.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=EpOkMi4muimBwiYrzJ~lpvZ8axJavZPLNvQTjH9oyTFnVUL~yfeehX0PV3ew-NF-OOucUWHP42y-eI1wdrGyNhB2sYRaSfK2AKUejfHuLNJ1dCo3nI7SDqxq8zWEvIiJdF5fQrbZXseGmM9gGh0h-0feCxzmPjgoD5~dxZgYND4lw4ofrrIOnqp2ctoJE1nvuJ9NyKcXBKT-~M76N0HRirnzxekwyUEkBku6hi~uXWpX~49DZgaKq2EhOlzUx54F~Z5KoGBRdpyMFD9-7QJt-l-bO0OW2Co6nowLShueYiAKsx6O5nI4k1eqp7k4svv9V3pDikKw-QIbaJTQXeesKg__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"2\u00a0\u00d7\u00a02 arcmin2 colour image of RXC J2248.7\u22124431 core, from the HST 16-band of the CLASH survey: blue\u00a0=\u00a0F435w+F475w; green\u00a0=\u00a0F606w+F625w+F775w+F814w+F850lp; red = F105w+F110w+F140w+F160w. We label the multiple lensed systems used in the strong lensing analysis (see Section\u00a05). The systems 12, 13 and the lensed image 11.c are new systems recently identified in the model. We verified that including these systems in the model is not changing significantly the final best model or the errors on the model parameters (see Section\u00a05 for more details). The red circles (ID0-4) label the quintuply lensed dropout candidate at z\u00a0\u223c\u00a06. The central image ID0 is selected after removing the BCG light (see Section\u00a06). With rD we label the other r-dropout candidate at z\u00a0\u223c\u00a05 identified through photometric selection (see Section\u00a03).\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig1.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975246/stt2284fig1.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig1.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975246\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284fig1.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=X2I-Gv-kEK37fLDQSPeqsUPxL9OGTF1sbQyv0PMMBPIxwOfh-IYUSfiS2PszMSuRbFxtLJbO9--ZvtG3rLuGOtaVPoxlW47wvMizxo8-TBfDsyk0vFsoGSKomz7SfEHc8BesWFwubUou0sG9q7DPVXxmMPkPxBsH3uOBZY~x~Q0Bt4gKdqUB0OcwD1ELvzXQBLSHqQqMI5VGl0UvjIyghSBkhWuzl1gOlO4cYXnMI46lCsEYlC~q0UJec2qs1~B1d36kuXmX4ojUmaaQhK7s9P6NnpYy1D-jo-FjYUqw3IpJr~Xj8y3rUnyGee1Lq~YheRrItirxYKebNJKrOfEuHQ__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975246&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig1.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">2\u00a0\u00d7\u00a02 arcmin<sup>2</sup> colour image of RXC J2248.7\u22124431 core, from the <em>HST</em> 16-band of the CLASH survey: blue\u00a0=\u00a0F435w+F475w; green\u00a0=\u00a0F606w+F625w+F775w+F814w+F850lp; red = F105w+F110w+F140w+F160w. We label the multiple lensed systems used in the strong lensing analysis (see Section\u00a05). The systems 12, 13 and the lensed image 11.c are new systems recently identified in the model. We verified that including these systems in the model is not changing significantly the final best model or the errors on the model parameters (see Section\u00a05 for more details). The red circles (ID0-4) label the quintuply lensed dropout candidate at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06. The central image ID0 is selected after removing the BCG light (see Section\u00a06). With rD we label the other r-dropout candidate at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a05 identified through photometric selection (see Section\u00a03).</p></div></div><p class=\"chapter-para\">RXC J2248 is a very massive galaxy cluster (<em>M</em><sub>200</sub> &gt; 2.5\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010<sup>15</sup>\u2009M<sub>\u2299</sub>) at <em>z</em>\u00a0=\u00a00.348 (Guzzo et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib27\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib27\" data-open=\"bib27\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2009</a>). It is part of the <em>ROSAT</em>-ESO Flux-Limited X-ray (REFLEX) survey galaxy cluster sample, and it is the second brightest cluster in this survey, with a luminosity of <em>L</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a03\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010<sup>45</sup>\u2009erg\u2009s<sup>\u22121</sup> in the rest-frame 0.1\u20132.4\u2009KeV interval (Guzzo et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib27\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib27\" data-open=\"bib27\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2009</a>). G\u00f3mez et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib23\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib23\" data-open=\"bib23\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>) confirmed 51 cluster members with spectroscopic observations taken with the Gemini Multi-Objects Spectrograph (GMOS), from which they estimate the mean effective velocity dispersion and redshift of the cluster to be <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$\\sigma =1660^{+230}_{-150}$|</span>\u2009km\u2009s<sup>\u22121</sup> and <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z=0.3461^{+0.0010}_{-0.0011}$|\u2060</span>. The galaxy density, obtained using spectroscopically confirmed and candidate (selected from the colour\u2013magnitude diagram) cluster members, combined with the X-ray isophotes, reveals several substructures and an elongation in NE\u2013SW direction. The X-ray analysis shows that the X-ray peak emission is shifted by 37\u00a0\u00b1\u00a09 arcsec with respect to the galaxy density peak. The combination of optical, spectroscopic and X-ray analysis thus reveals traces of recent merging activities. Gruen et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib26\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib26\" data-open=\"bib26\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2013</a>) performed a multi-wavelength weak lensing analysis of this cluster using deep UBVRIZ imaging data from the ESO-2.2-m Wide Field Imager, with a total integration time of about 50\u2009h. They accurately measured the 2D mass distribution and mass profile for scales larger than 500\u2009kpc, out to 4\u2009Mpc. Their mass map shows that the main dark matter halo is centred on the brightest cluster galaxy (BCG), and that dark matter substructures in and around the cluster coincide with galaxy density substructures, dominated by red galaxies. Fitting the dark halo with an NFW profile, they obtain the values <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$c_{200m}=2.6^{+1.5}_{-1.0}$|</span> and <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$M_{200m}=33.1^{+9.6}_{-6.8}\\cdot 10^{14} \\,\\mathrm{M}_{{\\odot }}$|\u2060</span>, in agreement with previous X-ray and SZ estimates. Due to its strong lensing strength, RXC J2248 is selected in the sample of six galaxy clusters of the deep frontier fields (FF) <em>HST</em> survey,<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-fn1\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"fn1\" data-open=\"fn1\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-fn js-xref-fn\"><sup>1</sup></a> which aims to map the cluster dark matter to the highest precision and derive magnification maps to investigate the high-redshift Universe.</p><p class=\"chapter-para\">Our paper is organized as follows. In Section\u00a02 we present the photometric data and redshifts. In Section\u00a03 we provide an overview of the dropout selection procedure we use and present the <em>z</em> &gt; 5 candidates selected in the field of RXC J2248, including the multiply lensed <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 galaxy. In Section\u00a04 we discuss the photometric evidence supporting the lensed high-<em>z</em>nature of our candidate. In Section\u00a05 we provide the strong lensing analysis of the cluster, and we show that the lensing model predicts our candidate to be at high redshift. In Section\u00a06 we present the fifth (central) image of the system, identified thanks to the lensing model and detected after subtracting the BCG light from the images. In Section\u00a07 we analyse the physical properties of the <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a06 candidate and compare it with other similar systems analysed in the CLASH survey. In Section\u00a08 we present our summary and conclusions.</p><p class=\"chapter-para\">In this paper we adopt the concordance \u039bcold dark matter cosmology with <em>h</em>\u00a0=\u00a00.7, \u03a9<sub>m0</sub> = 0.3 and \u03a9<sub>\u039b0</sub>\u00a0=\u00a00.7.</p>                    <h2 scrollto-destination=91975250 id=\"91975250\" class=\"section-title\" data-legacy-id=sec2>PHOTOMETRIC DATA SET</h2>\r\n<p class=\"chapter-para\">RXC J2248.7\u22124431 was observed between 2012 September and October in 16 filters covering the UV, optical and NIR range with the <em>HST</em> Advanced Camera for Surveys (ACS) and the <em>HST</em> Wide Field Camera 3 (WFC3) UVIS and IR cameras. See Table\u00a0<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-tbl1\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"tbl1\" data-open=\"tbl1\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">1</a> for the complete list of the filters.</p>                        <a id=\"91975252\" scrollto-destination=\"91975252\"></a>\r\n<div content-id=\"tbl1\" class=\"table-modal table-full-width-wrap\"><div class=\"table-wrap table-wide\"><div class=\"table-wrap-title\" id=\"tbl1\" data-id=\"tbl1\"><span class=\"label\">Table\u00a01.</span><div class=\"caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">RXC J2248 CLASH data set summary: Column 1 filters included in the survey, Column 2 total observation time in seconds; Column 3 <em>HST</em> instrument; Column 4 the 5\u03c3 magnitude depth within 0.6 arcsec.</p></div> </div><div class=\"table-overflow\"><table><thead><tr><th>Filter<span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th><th>Total time (s)<span class=\"table-modal\"><table><thead><tr><th>Filter<span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th><th>Total time (s)<span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th><th>Instrument<span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th><th>5\u03c3 depth<span aria-hidden=\"true\" style=\"display: none;\">\r\n            .\u00a0</span></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>f225w\u00a0</td><td>7148\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/UVIS\u00a0</td><td>25.43\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f275w\u00a0</td><td>7274\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/UVIS\u00a0</td><td>25.44\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f336w\u00a0</td><td>4718\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/UVIS\u00a0</td><td>25.74\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f390w\u00a0</td><td>4740\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/UVIS\u00a0</td><td>26.47\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f435w\u00a0</td><td>4102\u00a0</td><td>ACS/WFC\u00a0</td><td>26.35\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f475w\u00a0</td><td>2064\u00a0</td><td>ACS/WFC\u00a0</td><td>26.77\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f606w\u00a0</td><td>3976\u00a0</td><td>ACS/WFC\u00a0</td><td>27.07\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f625w\u00a0</td><td>4128\u00a0</td><td>ACS/WFC\u00a0</td><td>26.60\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f775w\u00a0</td><td>4058\u00a0</td><td>ACS/WFC\u00a0</td><td>26.30\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f814w\u00a0</td><td>8136\u00a0</td><td>ACS/WFC\u00a0</td><td>26.94\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f850lp\u00a0</td><td>6164\u00a0</td><td>ACS/WFC\u00a0</td><td>25.84\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f105w\u00a0</td><td>2815\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/IR\u00a0</td><td>26.86\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f110w\u00a0</td><td>2515\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/IR\u00a0</td><td>26.87\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f125w\u00a0</td><td>1509\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/IR\u00a0</td><td>26.88\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f140w\u00a0</td><td>2312\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/IR\u00a0</td><td>26.93\u00a0</td></tr><tr><td>f160w\u00a0</td><td>3520\u00a0</td><td>WFC3/IR\u00a0</td><td>26.96\u00a0</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div class=\"&#xA;          graphic-wrap&#xA;          \"><a class=\"fig-view-orig openInAnotherWindow btn js-view-large\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"/view-large/91975252\">\r\n          Open in new tab\r\n        </a></div></div></div><p class=\"chapter-para\">The <em>HST</em> data set is composed of mosaic drizzled science images and respective weight images produced with the M<span class=\"small-caps\">osaicdrizzle</span> pipeline (see Koekemoer et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib37\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib37\" data-open=\"bib37\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2011</a>). They have pixel scale of 65\u00a0mas\u00a0pixel<sup>\u22121</sup> and cover a field of view (FOV) of \u223c3.4\u00a0\u00d7\u00a03.4 arcmin<sup>2</sup> in the ACS images and \u223c2\u00a0\u00d7\u00a02 arcmin<sup>2</sup> in the WFC3IR images. Using SE<span class=\"small-caps\">xtractor</span> 2.5.0 (Bertin &amp; Arnouts <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib4\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib4\" data-open=\"bib4\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">1996</a>), we obtain a multiband photometric catalogue of galaxy fluxes extracted within 0.6 arcsec (nine\u00a0pixels) diameter aperture. We run SE<span class=\"small-caps\">xtractor</span> in dual image mode, using as detection image the weighted sum of all the WFC3IR images (see Section\u00a03 for more details about the choice of the detection image). We independently estimate the true aperture photometric uncertainties in each filter and compare them with the formal SE<span class=\"small-caps\">xtractor</span> uncertainties. We measure the real photometric errors for each detected source using the aperture photometry and sky background<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-fn2\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"fn2\" data-open=\"fn2\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-fn js-xref-fn\"><sup>2</sup></a> and find that the SE<span class=\"small-caps\">xtractor</span> errors are underestimated by a mean factor of 4 in our data set. In the rest of the paper we use photometric uncertainties corrected by this factor. Moreover, we compute the flux detection limit in each band by measuring the fluxes within 3000 random apertures of 0.6 arcsec diameter within the image FOV. We then fit a Gaussian to the flux measurement histogram, estimate the 1\u03c3 width and obtain the 5\u03c3 limiting magnitudes. The results are given in Table\u00a0<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-tbl1\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"tbl1\" data-open=\"tbl1\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">1</a>.</p>                    <h3 scrollto-destination=91975254 id=\"91975254\" class=\"section-title\" data-legacy-id=sec2-1>Cluster members: photometric and spectroscopic redshifts</h3>\r\n<div class=\"&#xA;            block-child-p&#xA;            \">We use the spectral energy distribution (SED) fitting code L<span class=\"small-caps\">e</span>P<span class=\"small-caps\">hare</span><span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-fn3\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"fn3\" data-open=\"fn3\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-fn js-xref-fn\"><sup>3</sup></a> (Arnouts et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib1\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib1\" data-open=\"bib1\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">1999</a>; Ilbert et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib33\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib33\" data-open=\"bib33\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2006</a>) to compute the photometric redshifts of galaxies to use for the selection of cluster members. The package computes photometric redshifts through a standard \u03c7<sup>2</sup> fitting method to fit the observed fluxes with template spectra, where the \u03c7<sup>2</sup> is defined as (Ilbert et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib33\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib33\" data-open=\"bib33\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2006</a>) <div class=\"formula-wrap\"><div class=\"disp-formula\" id=\"equ1\" content-id=\"equ1\"><div class=\"tex-math display-math\"> \\begin{equation}\r\n\\chi ^2(z,T,A)=\\sum _{f=1}^{N_{\\rm F}}\\left(\\frac{F^{f}_{\\mathrm{obs}}-A\\times F^{f}_{\\mathrm{pred}}(z,T)}{\\sigma _{\\mathrm{obs}}^f}\\right)^2\r\n\\end{equation} </div></div><span class=\"label\">(1)</span></div>where the index <em>f</em> refers to the filters of the data set, <em>N</em><sub>F</sub> is the number of filters, <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$F^{f}_{\\rm obs}$|</span> is the observed flux, \u03c3<sub>obs</sub><sup><em>f</em></sup> is its error, <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$F^{f}_{\\mathrm{pred}}(z,T)$|</span> is the estimated flux for the redshift <em>z</em> and the spectral type <em>T</em>, and finally <em>A</em> is a normalization factor. The photometric redshift is computed by searching for the solution (<em>z</em>, <em>T</em>, <em>A</em>) for which the \u03c7<sup>2</sup> is minimal.</div><p class=\"chapter-para\">Galaxy, quasi-stellar object (QSO) and star SED templates can be used in the templates set; moreover, extinction laws, emission lines and constraints on the range of redshift, age, absolute magnitude and other physical parameters can be included in the fitting procedure (see Arnouts et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib1\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib1\" data-open=\"bib1\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">1999</a>; Ilbert et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib33\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib33\" data-open=\"bib33\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2006</a>).</p><p class=\"chapter-para\">The output files give the photometric redshift values for the best fits each for the star, QSO and galaxy templates: in particular for the galaxy solutions, L<span class=\"small-caps\">e</span>P<span class=\"small-caps\">hare</span> computes the redshift probability distribution function (PDF(<em>z</em>)) and gives also the secondary solution from the PDF(<em>z</em>), if available.</p><p class=\"chapter-para\">We adopt as galaxy template set the COSMOS libraries (Ilbert et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib34\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib34\" data-open=\"bib34\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2009</a>), which include 31 templates describing SEDs of ellipticals, spirals and starburst galaxies. To take into account the extinction due to the interstellar medium (ISM) we apply the Calzetti extinction law (Calzetti et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib15\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib15\" data-open=\"bib15\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2000</a>) to the starburst templates, and the SMC Prevot law (Prevot et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib48\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib48\" data-open=\"bib48\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">1984</a>) to the Sc and Sd templates. We also include emission lines, and add prior information on the redshift distribution: for that the code uses an <em>N</em>(<em>z</em>) prior by type computed from the VVDS survey (see Ben\u00edtez <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib3\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib3\" data-open=\"bib3\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2000</a>; Ilbert et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib33\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib33\" data-open=\"bib33\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2006</a>). As QSOs template set we use the SWIRE library (Polletta et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib45\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib45\" data-open=\"bib45\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2006</a>; Hatziminaoglou et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib29\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib29\" data-open=\"bib29\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2005</a>; Gregg et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib24\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib24\" data-open=\"bib24\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2002</a>) including type 1, type 2, Seyfert 1.8 and Seyfert 2 AGN templates. Finally, as stellar templates we adopt the Pickles stellar library (Pickles <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib44\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib44\" data-open=\"bib44\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">1998</a>), which include all the normal spectral types, plus metal-poor F-K dwarves and G-K giants.</p><p class=\"chapter-para\">Greisel et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib25\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib25\" data-open=\"bib25\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2013</a>) carried out a systematic analysis of luminous red galaxies from the Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS) with 0\u00a0&lt;\u00a0<em>z</em>\u00a0&lt;\u00a00.5, which shows that local SED templates do not match within appropriate level the observed colours for galaxies at different redshifts, due to the evolution of the SEDs with redshift. Thus we expect that, using L<span class=\"small-caps\">e</span>P<span class=\"small-caps\">hare</span> libraries to estimate the cluster member photo-<em>z</em>, we predict different colours from what we actually observe in some filters. Indeed when we estimate the photometric redshift for the sources extracted in our images, the cluster appears to be at <em>z</em>\u00a0\u223c\u00a00.4 from the <em>z</em><sub>ph</sub> histogram. One way to account for the template mismatch of red SEDs at the <em>z</em><sub>cl</sub>\u00a0=\u00a00.348 is to apply some offsets correction to our photometry. To estimate these offsets we use the sample of spectroscopically confirmed cluster members. In L<span class=\"small-caps\">e</span>P<span class=\"small-caps\">hare</span> they are estimated through a colour adaptive method which finds the template that best fits the observed photometry given the fixed <em>z</em><sub>sp</sub> of the galaxies, and minimizes the offset between the observed and predicted magnitudes in each filter. We use 16 cluster members from the spectroscopic sample (G\u00f3mez et\u00a0al. <span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib23\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib23\" data-open=\"bib23\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>), which are in our WFC3IR FOV, to compute the magnitudes offsets in our filters, and apply these offsets to the observed photometry to compute the photometric redshift for the cluster member galaxies. The offsets we get are not significant (&lt;0.03\u2009mag) in the filters from f606w to f160w, while they are higher (between 0.1 and 0.36\u2009mag) in the blue filters (from f475w to f225w) showing that the adopted templates do not describe the early-type rest-frame SEDs well for wavelengths smaller than 3500 \u00c5. In Fig.\u00a0<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-fig2\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"fig2\" data-open=\"fig2\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">2</a> we plot the histogram of the offset corrected <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z_{\\rm ph}^{\\rm corr}$|</span> for the bright (<span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">\u2060|${\\rm f775w\\_mag\\_best}&lt;23$|\u2060</span>) galaxies extracted in our images, which shows a peak at the cluster redshift <em>z</em><sub>cl</sub>\u00a0\u223c\u00a00.35 when using the estimated magnitude offsets. We select 80 bright cluster member candidates with <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z_{\\rm ph}^{\\rm corr}$|</span> in the range [0.25, 0.45] and <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|${\\rm f775w\\_mag\\_best}&lt;23$|</span> best fitted with early-type templates, all of them lying on the red sequence in the colour\u2212magnitude diagram (see Fig.\u00a0<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-fig3\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"fig3\" data-open=\"fig3\" class=\"link link-reveal link-table xref-fig\">3</a>). We use this cluster members sample as the galaxy component in performing the strong lensing mass model of the cluster (see Section\u00a05).</p>                        <a id=\"91975260\" scrollto-destination=\"91975260\"></a>\r\n<div data-id=\"fig2\" class=\"fig fig-section js-fig-section\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure 2.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284fig2.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=iSDGj3pb0Oe504T9Tb6rpA9X24IQhlobNZEuBLCBn4fh06HO4YhspGLUdEjCUL7SsAg-02r2iEiWbQS2bYl0~8zmSpNlE1JoL5cJPkIrDhqJBF86UU2S5RWqph0yhY8SrQv~UBItVLq03-EmNA-XsgR9yosL0s177wqc4erQtjdrHtFn~S8SbDGhx7TIGXo8vProlGY0Xu1EP8xbojeW0-a6TAO5eO8IxDaje-xFUguGTZAK5Z-W6xm9DRWuYWYHVxf1V9PdSGcqYXx25F-DWwWeaXozWwqJQKDorB0Z~96ptj2cCJrbEcc7c2GJUo~Al0cdYPJHTd71TGKYob8yyg__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"Redshift distribution of sources extracted in the WFC3IR FOV of RXC J2248. In the <em>z</em><sub>ph</sub> distribution a peak is identified in correspondence with the spectroscopic <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z\\rm _{cl}$|\u2060</span>.</p></div></div><div content-id=\"fig2\" class=\"fig fig-modal reveal-modal\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure 2.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284fig2.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=iSDGj3pb0Oe504T9Tb6rpA9X24IQhlobNZEuBLCBn4fh06HO4YhspGLUdEjCUL7SsAg-02r2iEiWbQS2bYl0~8zmSpNlE1JoL5cJPkIrDhqJBF86UU2S5RWqph0yhY8SrQv~UBItVLq03-EmNA-XsgR9yosL0s177wqc4erQtjdrHtFn~S8SbDGhx7TIGXo8vProlGY0Xu1EP8xbojeW0-a6TAO5eO8IxDaje-xFUguGTZAK5Z-W6xm9DRWuYWYHVxf1V9PdSGcqYXx25F-DWwWeaXozWwqJQKDorB0Z~96ptj2cCJrbEcc7c2GJUo~Al0cdYPJHTd71TGKYob8yyg__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"Redshift distribution of sources extracted in the WFC3IR FOV of RXC J2248. In red we plot the distribution of spectroscopic redshift from G\u00f3mez et\u00a0al. (2012). In the zph distribution a peak is identified in correspondence with the spectroscopic $z\\rm _{cl}$.\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig2.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975260/stt2284fig2.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig2.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975260\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284fig2.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=Ww6y8ZmtV7Q8-TcJ0dFysUX-7gEiwHgEhIQ-8ND~HyU1IQBb~qlJkN7hj-NpXyJXx6vEPFzreYLJ9DpHp61o97IRTeoiYW3F6sHezW51GeCQMg-grVY~ZwVF-fRct7e16FewEw4W~O9MsWNK7fE8szthYXqw3ZhCJAoIjqKL1gH-Ss04axhPTU7BlDFggG~~v4zYgqIP7Af74~TVL5gXpu5-~j37uaiUoG9zr5B59R~3VqHeewTbAu3sqlvuumajlgBA3pkBZ4WStyKjF2hxhzpZfBsnQRyGyNWxTMEYS6VeBtehnqEGgt4whLcsItprmmzZZU13CkDGyHbNjW0vCQ__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975260&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig2.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Redshift distribution of sources extracted in the WFC3IR FOV of RXC J2248. In blue we plot the distribution of the corrected photometric redshifts <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z_{\\rm ph}^{\\rm corr}$|</span> computed with L<span class=\"small-caps\">e</span>P<span class=\"small-caps\">hare</span> for sources with <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|${\\rm f775w\\_mag\\_best&lt;23}$|\u2060</span>, within the range <em>z</em><sub>ph</sub>\u00a0=\u00a0[0.25, 0.45]. In red we plot the distribution of spectroscopic redshift from G\u00f3mez et\u00a0al. (<span class=\"xrefLink\" id=\"jumplink-bib23\"></span><a href=\"javascript:;\" reveal-id=\"bib23\" data-open=\"bib23\" class=\"link link-ref link-reveal xref-bibr\">2012</a>). In the <em>z</em><sub>ph</sub> distribution a peak is identified in correspondence with the spectroscopic <span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$z\\rm _{cl}$|\u2060</span>.</p></div></div>                        <a id=\"91975261\" scrollto-destination=\"91975261\"></a>\r\n<div data-id=\"fig3\" class=\"fig fig-section js-fig-section\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure 3.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284fig3.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=tH6nK3wk00b1Nu6BwSXFV72cUu4ScIAKRimDlJi7H-Vfa6iSRX8~03haiw61ZyhvsIkY6rAFSJE9PiDW1XxhwfK9BTYM4N9uA~8iNNZ~Nx6Q9Zyz53rHoth6P1DVW4Hxc3z71-e55T4jdDx4QQaAxA8EUkmf5jKMx~Pf4TYKMwaYp~GSxKzsbeFQlOT55KODqCj-13EjPZDtl1-eqkS-sLdPieyH5GrkByI1uVFE-I5j5mWtZDzIszQa1VhGCPR1BLjw42Zjt6Xcx-fSy7O2jeOf7BjH6bB3IpwH7EM8EKUro2La31F4k1Cl~7h0~1iLhZmmHKan6Xq~jbO7TfD54g__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"Colour\u2013magnitude diagram for sources extracted in the WFC3IR FOV of RXC J2248. We plot the colour from the aperture magnitudes f435w and f775w, versus the SExtractor mag$\\_$best in the f775w filter. Blue circles are all the sources extracted in the WFC3IR FOV; red circles are the spectroscopic confirmed cluster members from G\u00f3mez et\u00a0al. (2012); green circles are cluster member candidates with zph \u2208 [0.25, 0.45] and ${\\rm f775w\\_mag\\_best&lt;22.5}$. We select 86 bright cluster member candidates within the 2\u00a0\u00d7\u00a02 arcmin2 WFC3IR FOV, which almost all lie on the red sequence of the cluster.\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig3.jpeg\" /><div class=\"fig-orig original-slide\"><a class=\"fig-view-orig js-view-large openInAnotherWindow\" href=\"/view-large/figure/91975261/stt2284fig3.jpeg\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig3.jpeg\" target=\"_blank\">Open in new tab</a><a data-section=\"91975261\" href=\"/DownloadFile/DownloadImage.aspx?image=https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/stt2284fig3.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&Signature=NxbeEG-oa7iTpYkCEfiYdYWtQ911DiEyUXmHIEH6H2Oyo6KOdyYB7G4vCLeFrNqJRI9adOBf1Oxa8CatNlz9cDXB568Y97hmSDS7FU-gcFgVYYeyK7~bFqgmkwFLS9gMp8mTzZgPsZ8FhpoUTICfsf6zdrDv8YK8FQJ2LvUYdn47tdTfVXf0nBvssTtCe~urM3IFoV5tYPoE6LPLqsQm7wzr5I36nL5BiTcgv4fR0dV~pD928csnEGWyX9NZkqf6uHvzq6Z5EWcNVV2WLkI3d1HWt52tqyhUT6-sBgVsZOQHR8W7fBo9yurrRU8ZSF81uxzJ0zRkma4kFYKDuniw6Q__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA&sec=91975261&ar=1010021&xsltPath=~/UI/app/XSLT&imagename=&siteId=5326\" class=\"download-slide\" data-path-from-xml=\"stt2284fig3.jpeg\">Download slide</a></div></div><div class=\"caption fig-caption\"><p class=\"chapter-para\">Colour\u2013magnitude diagram for sources extracted in the WFC3IR FOV of RXC J2248. We plot the colour from the aperture magnitudes f435w and f775w, versus the SE<span class=\"small-caps\">xtractor</span> mag<span class=\"inline-formula no-formula-id\">|$\\_$|</span>best in the f775w filter. Blue circles are all the sources extracted in the WFC3IR FOV; red circles are the spectroscopic confirmed cluster members from G\u00f3mez et\u00a0al. We select 86 bright cluster member candidates within the 2\u00a0\u00d7\u00a02 arcmin<sup>2</sup> WFC3IR FOV, which almost all lie on the red sequence of the cluster.</p></div></div><div content-id=\"fig3\" class=\"fig fig-modal reveal-modal\"><div class=\"label fig-label\">Figure 3.</div><div class=\"graphic-wrap\"><img class=\"content-image\" src=\"https://oup.silverchair-cdn.com/oup/backfile/Content_public/Journal/mnras/438/2/10.1093_mnras_stt2284/2/m_stt2284fig3.jpeg?Expires=1611467749&amp;Signature=tH6nK3wk00b1Nu6BwSXFV72cUu4ScIAKRimDlJi7H-Vfa6iSRX8~03haiw61ZyhvsIkY6rAFSJE9PiDW1XxhwfK9BTYM4N9uA~8iNNZ~Nx6Q9Zyz53rHoth6P1DVW4Hxc3z71-e55T4jdDx4QQaAxA8EUkmf5jKMx~Pf4TYKMwaYp~GSxKzsbeFQlOT55KODqCj-13EjPZDtl1-eqkS-sLdPieyH5GrkByI1uVFE-I5j5mWtZDzIszQa1VhGCPR1BLjw42Zjt6Xcx-fSy7O2jeOf7BjH6bB3IpwH7EM8EKUro2La31F4k1Cl~7h0~1iLhZmmHKan6Xq~jbO7TfD54g__&amp;Key-Pair-Id=APKAIE5G5CRDK6RD3PGA\" alt=\"Colour\u2013magnitude diagram for sources extracted in the WFC3IR FOV of RXC J2248.
